'''Swanna''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''スワンナ''' ''Swanna'') is a dual-type {{2t|Water|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Ducklett}} starting at [[level]] 35.

==Biology==
Swanna is a swan-like Pokémon with primarily white plumage. Its beak is long and yellow topped with a black cere, and it has several white feathery features adorning its head. The more rounded of the features are to the sides of its head, and the more pointed feature is atop. Swanna possesses a long, curving neck. With a fluid neck and a strong bill, Swanna is capable of very accurate jabbing and thrusting attacks. Two light-blue feathery features, similar to those on the sides of Swanna's head, are present on Swanna's underside, and Swanna's large wings are positioned so that they curve away from its body. Swanna's legs are small, and its webbed feet are dark. Swanna is known to fly for thousands of miles without rest. Swanna flies out when the sun rises. At dusk, flocks of Swanna will dance, with the leader in the middle of the routine.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Keanan Swanna.png|thumb|250px|Swanna in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[Skyla's Swanna]]=====
A Swanna debuted in ''[[BW067|Cilan Takes Flight!]]'', under the ownership of [[Skyla]]. It was first used in her battle against {{an|Cilan}}, where it was able to defeat {{TP|Cilan|Crustle}} and {{TP|Cilan|Stunfisk}}. It reappeared in ''[[BW068|An Amazing Aerial Battle!]]'', where it was used in a Gym battle against {{Ash}}. It defeated {{AP|Pikachu}}, but fell to Ash's newly evolved {{AP|Unfezant}}.

=====Other=====
A Swanna appeared in ''[[BW021|The Lost World of Gothitelle!]]'', under the ownership of [[Officer Jenny]]. Multiple Swanna later appeared in ''[[BW081|Crisis at Ferroseed Research!]]'', under the ownership of another Officer Jenny.

A Swanna appeared in ''[[BW107|Cameron's Secret Weapon!]]'', under the ownership of {{un|Cameron}}. It was used in his battle against {{Ash}}, where it was defeated by {{AP|Pikachu}}.

Multiple Swanna appeared in ''[[XY069|Defending the Homeland!]]''. Two of them reappeared in ''[[XY070|Beyond the Rainbow!]]'', ''[[XY139|Facing the Needs of the Many!]]'', and ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]''.

====Minor appearances====
A flock of Swanna appeared in ''[[BW001|In The Shadow of Zekrom!]]''.

Multiple Swanna appeared in the ending credits of ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom]]'', and in the opening sequence of ''[[M14|Black—Victini and Reshiram]]''.

Two Swanna appeared in [[PK22]].

A Swanna appeared in ''[[BW051|Lost at the Stamp Rally!]]'', where it was seen performing in a [[Pokémon Musical]] show.

Multiple Swanna appeared in ''[[BW056|The Lonely Deino!]]'', under the care of a {{pkmn|Day Care}} owner named [[Bobby]].

Multiple Swanna appeared in ''[[BW059|Stopping the Rage of Legends! Part 1]]''.

A Swanna appeared in ''[[BW080|Clash of the Connoisseurs!]]''.

A Swanna appeared in ''[[BW083|Rocking the Virbank Gym! Part 1]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Trainer}} who lost to [[Roxie]].

Multiple Swanna appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]''.

Multiple Swanna appeared in ''[[BW098|Beauties Battling for Pride and Prestige!]]''.

A Swanna briefly appeared in ''[[BW099|A Surface to Air Tag Battle Team!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Swanna appeared in ''[[BW112|Team Plasma's Pokémon Power Plot!]]''.

A Trainer's Swanna appeared in ''[[BW125|Cilan and the Case of the Purrloin Witness!]]''.

A Swanna appeared in ''[[BW127|The Island of Illusions!]]''.

Multiple Swanna appeared in ''[[BW130|Butterfree and Me!]]''.

A Swanna was among the {{type|Flying}} Pokémon who raced {{OBP|Mewtwo|Best Wishes series}} in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]''.

Multiple Swanna appeared in flashbacks in ''[[BW134|The Journalist from Another Region!]]'' and ''[[BW136|A Pokémon of a Different Color!]]''.

Multiple Swanna appeared in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]'', with one of them reappearing during a flashback in ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]''.

A Swanna appeared in ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]''.

Multiple Swanna appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

A Trainer's Swanna appeared in ''[[XY041|Foggy Pokémon Orienteering!]]'' and ''[[XY042|Battling Into the Hall of Fame!]]''.

Multiple Swanna appeared in a flashback in ''[[XY055|A Slippery Encounter!]]'', including one dropping a {{p|Goomy}} on {{Ash}}'s head.

A {{pkmn|Performer}}'s Swanna appeared in ''[[XY060|A Showcase Debut!]]'', where it participated in the [[Coumarine City]] [[Pokémon Showcase]]. It reappeared in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]'', where it participated in the [[Dendemille Town]] Showcase.

A Swanna appeared in the Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures short ''{{DL|Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures|Flying in the Air}}''.

A Swanna appeared in ''[[XY077|A Relay in the Sky!]]'', where it was seen competing in the [[Pokémon Sky Relay]].

Two Swanna appeared in ''[[SM046|Deceiving Appearances!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Swanna was first seen in a video for the [[Pokémon Musical]]s, again when its art leaked on Yahoo's Pokémon website, and finally in the September issue of CoroCoro.

===Origin===
Swanna is based on a {{wp|mute swan}}, and its evolutionary line is based on the fairy tale, ''{{wp|The Ugly Duckling}}''. Additionally, its design seems to draw inspiration from the outfit worn by the main character of the ''{{wp|Swan Lake}}'' {{wp|ballet}}, {{wp|Swan Lake#Odette|Odette}}.

===Name origin===
Swanna is derived from ''swan'' and may be a combination of ''swan'' and ''ballerina''.
